GodsDescription.ZeusF:
Sky and thuder god, 
child of Cronus and Rhea, 
swallowed by his father 
Cronus, Zeus lived in his 
stomach until adulthood before 
cutting it open. His thunderbolt, 
always held in his right hand was a 
gift from the cyclops after Zeus freed 
them from Uranus.
GodsDescription.PoseidonF:
Lord of the sea, 
Poseidon created the 
horses in the shapes of 
the breaking waves. He 
has blue eyes and hair which 
resembles the color of the sea. 
Whenever he strucks the ground 
with his trident, the earth trembles 
and mountains are raised.
GodsDescription.HadesF:
Underworld god, 
Hades is famous for being 
the only Olympian god 
that didn't live on Mount 
Olympus. Very few tales exists 
with Hades, since he barely leaves 
the underworld, the most famous is 
when Hades abducted Persephone
GodsDescription.RaF:
King of the gods, Ra 
is the representation of 
life and growth. Also known 
for the Eye of Ra, the Eye of 
Ra is considered an extension 
of Ra's power, sometimes the 
Eye of Ra is Ra's female 
counterpart itself. The eye can 
be both protective as well as a 
fraction of Ra's destructive power.
GodsDescription.IsisF:
Isis was married to 
Osiris, she revived him 
and protected their heir 
Horus. Isis helped the dead 
ones to enter the afterlife. She 
was worshipped because of her 
healing powers, she could cure the 
sick. Isis is also considered one of 
the most wise deities.
GodsDescription.SetF:
God of chaos and violence. 
Unlike other egyptian gods, 
Set's animal counterpart 
wasn't recognized by any 
modern animal, it could have been 
from pure mythology itself, or 
some other breed not known today.
GodsDescription.LokiF:
Famous for being the 
trickster deity, Loki is in 
most Norse poems and 
usually its schemes never end 
up as expected. Loki is neither 
an evil or good deity, Loki 
always does what seems most 
profitable at the moment, be it 
helping the gods or the giants.
GodsDescription.OdinF:
Odin is mostly 
known as the one-eyed father. 
Father because he is 
one of the oldest and main 
god on Valhalla. Odin sacrificed 
his eye to see everything that 
happens on the world.
GodsDescription.HelF:
Hel is a ruler of 
the underworld, her name is no 
coincidence. Daughter of Loki, 
there is a tale about the revival 
 of Balder where she only consent 
Balder's release if everyone wept 
for him. There was only a single 
Giantess who didn't, very likely it was 
Loki in disguise.
GodsDescription.ThorF:
Wielding the mighty 
Mjolnir, Thor was famous for 
being the thunder god and 
also for not planning on his 
actions. Thor takes direct actions 
and jumps into battle 
anytime he can.
GodsDescription.AmaterasuF:
Amaterasu is the sun 
goddess, also known as 
the universe goddess and 
ruler. After Tsukiyomi killed 
Uke Mochi, she has became 
separated from Tsukiyomi. Day 
and night has been apart ever 
since. She represents order and 
purity iluminating all living things.
GodsDescription.TsukuyomiF:
Moon god from the 
japanese mythology, 
born from Izanagi's right 
eye. Lived in the heavens 
together with his sister 
Amaterasu, goddess of the sun, 
Tsukiyomi angered Amaterasu 
killing Uke Mochi, she was so 
angry that she refused to ever 
look again at Tsukiyomi.
GodsDescription.IzanamiF:
She is together with 
Izanagi known as the gods 
of creation. Izanami dies 
giving birth to Kagu-tsuchi, 
Izanagi went to the Yomi(land 
of the dead), but she could not 
return to the living world. Once 
he discovered her appearance was 
rotting, he ran away. She kills the 
living beings as vengence.
GodsDescription.IzanagiF:
Deity of creation, 
Izanagi gave creation to all 
the japanese archipelago. 
Since Izanami cursed the world, 
she started to kill the people, 
and to counter this, Izanagi 
made a vowing that more people 
would be born than she could kill.

TutorialText.text1:
\.You are about to start your journey in Kamigami! 
Before you start dueling, do you want to 
 know how to play the card game?
TutorialText.text4:
\.You will be able to access the tutorial at any 
time on the options at the main menu!
TutorialText.text5:
\.You finished the Greek arc! You are now allowed to buy egyptian boosters 
on the shop, you will also gain 5 egyptian boosters and a new egyptian 
deck to choose from!
TutorialText.text6:
\.You finished the egyptian arc! You are now allowed to buy norse boosters 
on the shop, you will also gain 7 norse boosters and a new norse 
deck to choose from!
TutorialText.text7:
\.You finished the norse arc! You are now allowed to buy japanese boosters 
on the shop, you will also gain 9 japanese boosters and a new japanese 
deck to choose from!

MenuText.booster1: Touch a Pack to open it!
MenuText.booster2: Go to the shop to buy booster packs!
MenuText.booster3: Touch the screen to put away the cards.
MenuText.deckselect2: You can't delete a deck that is currently being used!
MenuText.deckselect4: You can't edit a deck that is currently being used!
MenuText.deckselect5: You can only choose a deck that has 40 cards and a god card!
MenuText.deckbuild2: The deck needs a God/Goddess card!
MenuText.deckbuild14: When editing a deck you are using, it needs 40 cards and a god card!
MenuText.title1: You have to start a campaign first!
MenuText.title2: You have to win a duel in campaign first!
MenuText.title3: Error retrieving Steam information, try again!
MenuText.afterDuel02: is now playable in duel mode
MenuText.tip01: Tip: Hold the left mouse button to open the boosters faster
MenuText.tip02: Tip: Hold the left mouse button to buy boosters faster
MenuText.tip03: Tip: Hold the right mouse button or the space bar to speed up the game
MenuText.tip04: Ranked will start on August 6th, but you can already play online!
MenuText.cardInfo00: Devotion used to play this card
MenuText.cardInfo01: Devotion this cards generates on the field
MenuText.cardInfo02: Devotion this card uses when attacking
MenuText.cardInfo03: Devotion this card uses when moving
MenuText.deckBuildInfo3: ADD OR REMOVE ALL CARDS (IF POSSIBLE)
MenuText.lobbyText1:
RANK ORDER 
you need to gather 
3 stars for each rank 
before advancing to 
the next!
MenuText.lobbyText2: Once you are in the god/goddess rank, your star rank will fluctuate depending on your position among other players instead of being just progressive. The star ranking depends on your match results and the amount of duels played in a certain time. Your ranking will grant you prizes inside the game! Be ready to be delivered some special treats for playing well!
MenuText.lobbyJoin: Choose a room to join, if no room is created you will return to the lobby
MenuText.selectPlayer:
Hello adventurer! 
It is time to choose who you are in the god's realm! 
First of all, what is your name?

SkillsDescription.movement:
Move to this spot?
It will cost: |X| devotion
SkillsDescription.attack:
Attack this card for |Z| damage?
It will cost: |X| devotion
SkillsDescription.cast:
Play this card?
It will cost: |X| devotion
SkillsDescription.special:
Use this card's ability?
It will cost: |X| devotion
SkillsDescription.giveup: Are you sure you want to resign?
SkillsDescription.mulliganText: If you keep, this will be your starting hand. If you choose to mulligan, your hand will be separated into another pile and you will draw a new hand with one less card than the previous hand. When you decide to keep, all cards separated will be put on the bottom of the deck
SkillsDescription.mulliganText2: You will play first, your opponent will gain extra devotion
SkillsDescription.mulliganText3: You will play second, you will gain extra devotion

TutorialDescription.draw: Each player starts the game drawing 5 cards.
TutorialDescription.keep:
For this tutorial we will keep this hand! 
Do notice for other games you will need to evaluate
how strong is your hand before keeping it!
Mulligan is a part of card games to avoid one-sided games,
it gives players a new chance to have a playable hand.
The rules to mulligan on Kamigami are just below your cards drawn.
TutorialDescription.devotionPhase:
The Kamigami duel is divided into different phases, the first one is 
the devotion, cards you control on the board give you different devotions.
This devotion is used to play more cards.
TutorialDescription.startPhase:
Some cards have effects on the beginning of the turn, those effects 
are applied after the devotion phase, the effects applied are described on 
the card itself.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase1:
These are the values on each card, this is the devotion it will cost to 
play this card.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase2:
This is the devotion this card will generate on the devotion phase, 
It can only generate devotion if it is in the battlefield.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase3:
This is the amount of hitpoints this card has, if this value reaches 
zero it will be destroyed.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase4:
This is the amount of damage this card deals, deities, creatures and gods 
can attack other cards on the battlefield.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase5:
This is the amount of devotion you need to use to move this card in the 
battlefield.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase6:
This is the amount of devotion you need to use to attack your opponent's 
card in the battlefield.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase7:
This is the card type, Kamigami has 5 card types and each have unique styles 
of play, in this tutorial you will learn how each card is played!
TutorialDescription.mainPhase8:
This is your total devotion, devotions are not removed when you pass the turn.
This is the most important resource on Kamigami, it is used for almost every
action on the game, knowing how to use this resource is a key to victory!
TutorialDescription.mainPhase9:
This is your opponent's total devotion, always keep an eye to know what 
your opponent can and can't play on their turn!
TutorialDescription.mainPhase10:
This area is the graveyard, when cards are destroyed or miracle cards 
are used, they go to this area, some cards can interact with the graveyard.
TutorialDescription.mainPhase11:
This is your deck, you will draw a new card on the beginning of your 
turn. Now less talking and lets start playing the game!
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay1:
We will play our first card, currently you have 5 devotion, 
there is only one card in your hand playable for this cost. 
Cards can only be played close to a card you control, go to your hand 
and choose the playable card, there will be indications on the board where 
that card can be placed.
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay2:
Congratulations! You played your first card! The card you 
played is a monument, it has powerful effects, but it can't move 
or attack, protecting your monuments to deliver powerful effects is one way 
to win your games!.
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay3:
Now that you used your devotion, you can proceed to pass 
the turn.
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay4:
Now it is your second turn! Notice you now have 6 devotion. 
The monument is delivering extra devotion for you! Lets play our 
first deity!
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay5:
Nicely played! Do notice deities, gods and creatures can 
move and attack also! For this tutorial I will give you 5 extra devotion. 
Lets try moving your first card on the battlefield! 
You just have to click on the card on the battlefield and then 
click on the slot you want to move!
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay6:
Great! Now you know how cards can move on the battlefield. 
This is a very useful tool to create strategies on both 
how to attack your opponent and how to defend your cards.
You can pass the turn now.
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay7:
Your opponent has played a powerful creature, but now 
we can punish his play by using a miracle card. Miracle cards 
are powerful one-time effects. Check your hand, 
you have a very powerful miracle card ready to be used!
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay8:
Perfect! This will destroy his only card on the battlefield. 
In this game you are much ahead in terms of development, 
Kamigami is a game where you need to evaluate the best play 
at all times! Now that you know the basics it is time to finish 
this match.
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay9:
Here are 200 devotion just to show you how to end the game! 
Use this devotion I am giving you to destroy the opponent's 
god card, once a god card falls the game ends. 
 If a card you control is next to an opponent's card, you can attack it!
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay10:
You didn't use your devotion effectively, but I will give 
you 200 extra devotion, use it wisely to destroy the opponent's 
god card! Do remember if a card you control is next to an 
opponent's card, you can attack it!
TutorialDescription.tutorialPlay11:
Congratulations! You just won the game! Once a god card 
has fallen the game ends, create new and imaginative strategies 
to dominate Kamigami! This tutorial ends here, 
but you can always access this from the main menu!
TutorialDescription.tutorialError1:
Don't use your devotion to move a card now! Use it 
to get rid of a threat on the battlefield, 
you have a card on your hand to deal with his creature!
TutorialDescription.tutorialError2: You have more things to do on your turn before you pass.
TutorialDescription.tutorialRemember1: You have more things to do on your turn before you pass.

Campaign.mouseText1: Left click to zoom the map!
Campaign.mouseText2: Right click to unzoom the map!
Campaign.prologue01:
Yeah! I won the Kamigami card tournament. I am simply the best!
 There is nothing that would spoil this day.
Campaign.prologue02:
Wait, is that the ultra rare rank S foil Zeus card just laying on 
the street?
Campaign.prologue03: This day can't get any better!
Campaign.prologue06: Sorry to say, but you just got hit by a truck...
Campaign.prologue07:
I'm... Dead? I can't believe I died in such a dumb way! 
Is this some type of purgatory?
Campaign.prologue08:
You aren't dead, yet. I am keeping you alive for I am Coaraci 
the sun goddess and I need your help.
Campaign.prologue09:
You see, the gods are being controlled by an evil force. 
The only way to free them is by beating them in a duel! 
You are the best player we have.
Campaign.prologue10: And if I don't help, you just let me die?
Campaign.prologue11:
See! You are smart also. No time to lose! Choose your 
deck and your mission will start now!
Campaign.prologue12: That is a cliche way to start an Isekai, but I don't think I have any choice.
Campaign.prologue13:
Nice choice! Now you will have access to the god's realm, a place only the sacred can enter! 
You will face many difficulties, but I believe you will be able to overcome them!
Campaign.prologue14:
Would you like to play the tutorial? 
It will be accessible at all times in the main menu options.
